Syllabary Linear-A: Linear-B :
A- 𐘇 A 𐘡 E 𐘚 I 𐘵 O 𐘉 U 𐙆 a- 𐀀 a 𐀁 e 𐀂 i 𐀃 o 𐀄 u 𐃂
D- 𐘀 DA 𐘦 DE 𐘆 DI 𐚋•DO 𐚩 •DU₂ d- 𐀅 da 𐀆 de 𐀇 di 𐀈 do 𐀉 du
J- 𐘱 JA 𐘧 JE 𐙎 •JI 𐙽•JO 𐙏•JU j- 𐀊 ja 𐀋 je 𐀍 jo 𐀎 ju
K- 𐘾 KA 𐘥 KE 𐘸 KI 𐘺•KO 𐙂 KU k- 𐀏 ka 𐀐 ke 𐀑 ki 𐀒 ko 𐀓 ku
M- 𐙁 MA 𐘋 ME 𐘒 MI 𐙗•MO 𐘕 MU m- 𐀔 ma 𐀕 me 𐀖 mi 𐀗 mo 𐀘 mu
N- 𐘅 NA 𐘗 NE! 𐘝 NI 𐘩 NWA 𐘯 NU n- 𐀙 na 𐀚 ne 𐀛 ni 𐀜 no 𐀝 nu
P- 𐘂 PA 𐙠•PE 𐘢 PI 𐘊 PO 𐘫 PU p- 𐀞 pa 𐀟 pe 𐀠 pi 𐀡 po 𐀢 pu
Q- 𐘌 QA 𐘿 QE 𐘏 QI 𐙴 •QO / QU q- 𐀣 qa 𐀤 qe 𐀥 qi 𐀦 qo 𐀒 qoo
R- 𐘴 RA 𐘙 RE 𐚌•RI 𐝁𐘁 RO 𐘘 RU r- 𐀨 ra 𐀩 re 𐀪 ri 𐀫 ro 𐀬 ru
S- 𐘞 SA 𐘈 SE 𐘤≈𐙛•SI 𐙰•SO 𐘲 SU s- 𐀭 sa 𐀮 se 𐀯 si 𐀰 so 𐀱 su
T- 𐘳 TA 𐘃 TE 𐘠 TI 𐘄 TO 𐘹 TU t- 𐀲 ta 𐀳 te 𐀴 ti 𐀵 to 𐀶 tu
W- 𐘮 WA 𐘽•WR 𐘣 WI 𐙚•WO 𐚊•WU w- 𐀷 wa 𐀸 we 𐀹 wi 𐀺 wo vir Z- 𐘍 ZA 𐘼 ZE / ZI 𐘎 ZO 𐙀 ZU z- 𐀼 za 𐀽 ze 𐀿 zo 𐁙 zu

R/L S/Š P/B series are collapsed W≈V≈F

Syllabic signs

( appearing within proper words, but are often ommited in matrix ) :

𐝥 looks like wavy flag ≈ 𐊥 /r/ @ Carian
𐝥 𔖰 𔖲 ra @ Anatolian
𐝥 𐙕 •R / •L ⇔ 𐀪 ri 𒇽 LÚ
𐘴 𐝢 RA / LA

𐚌 𐙪 •RI 𐀪 𐂀 ri 𓎝 𓎛 𐠦 #ro or :
𐚌 𐙪 𐋁 Ɡ @ Berber ⇔ 𐙿 𓍱 ⴴ ɣ γ gʳ G₂ @ Berber 𐙬 𐙞 𐚃 𓍲 𓍶 #šn ǧn •gn 𐁘 SWI
𐚌 𐙪 𐋁 γ /ᵑkʷ/ @ Carian 𐋀 𐁘 in Linear-B
𐚌 𐙪 𐋁 𐋄 ĝ @ Carian Ϫ ϫ ʒ dʒ @ Coptic
𐚌 𐙪 𐋁 𐋄 𐀋 JE < G in 𐀂𐀋𐀩 𐀊 ʰiᵍ-e-re-jaⁿ Hexerin 𓎛 𓂓 𓄿 𓀁 𓏪 𓋾
𐚌 𐜢 𐀆 de 𐚌 •dje ʒe ǵe
𐚌 𐜢 𐀐 ke ≈ kʷ

𐘟 𐙠 •PE 𐁓 𐀟 pe •PH φ
𐘟 𐙠 ⇔ 𐂵 𐃗 moon
𐁔 𐘨 •KR χρυσ
𐙛 •ŠI ≈ 𐀯 si ≈ 𐘤 SI
𐙛 ⇔ 𐙯·𐘂 •sip
𐙯 ⇔ 𐙯·𐙫 𐘢 PI 𐀠 pi
𐙯 ⇔ 𐀴 ti 𓏏 t
𐘐 ewe? αἶγες? ⲱⲛϧ? sheep capre? ⇔ 𐘏 qi⋍goat | 𐘑 bock | 𐚽 she-goat| 𐘏 qi ⋍ 𐘕 cattle

𐘬 DU dude ⇔ 𐂁 𐂩 ?

prefix and suffix signs are ignored since they may be determinants
Other signs which do not appear within known words yet but fit the matrix nicely:

suggested matches

Since the syllabic correspondence between Linear-A and Linear-B seems near perfect regardless of the underlying language of Linear-A (possibly some Luwian dialect?), the following resemblances are proposed:

𐙴 •QO 𐀦 qo
𐙋 •NU 𔒴 nu 𜎜 NU 𜎝 NO ( Anatolian / Elamite ! )
𐀍 jo 𐙽 •JO 99% suffix in Linear-B so not used in Linear-A!
𐀍 jo 𐙎 •JO₂
𐀎 ju 𐙏 •JU
𐀰 so 𐙰 •SOᵖ 𓋴
𐀈 do 𐚋 •DO 𐚉 …
𐘫 PU 𐘜 PU₂ 𐘪 ?
𐀉 du 𐚩 •DU
𐀸 we 𐘽 •WR > RA₂
𐀺 wo 𐙚•WO 𐚊•WU ⇔ woman, vir gender 𐙪𐙚 ≈ 𐚌𐙚
𐀯 si 𐙛 •SI₂ ⇔ 𐘤
𐙆 ⇔ 𔗷 A 𔗸 ar •arm 𐀖 mi manu
𐀟 pe 𐙠 •PE ⇔ 𐚓 𐚀 ⇔
𐘟 𜑾 PA 𜑿 𜑹
𐘊 PO 𐚒 P 𜎮
𐙦 𜎑 𜎏 𜎎 SO / MO ?
𐝆 𓐞 ½ ⇔ 𓐝 𓂋 mere / meso

𐂎 𐘹 𐙢 𐃉 𐃋 𐘹 TU dagger series
𐚠 𐘹 𐛗 𐛺 𐘸 𐜧 𐜨 𐜩 𐜪 𐜫 | 𐀑 𐀶 𐂎

𐚁 𐜦 𐙔 | 𐃃 hat
𐙮 𐂴 𐂜 𐘿

Linear A sits firmly in the context of contemporary writing systems:
𒉺 PA 𐠞 pa 𐘂 PA 𐀞 pa 𐎔 PA π pi 𐎲 B ( Mesopotamian, Aegean…, Ugaritic, Anatolian Elamite )

The semantics can often be explained much earlier than the phonetics or the underlying language.
Many animal gender series are identical to Linear-B :

𐚲 𐜶 vs 𐙼 vs
𐙄 hog
𐁂 AU das Schwein swine
𐂊 SAU die Sau 𓆄 𓅱 𓃟 shoat 𒋰𒋾𒆲 #šahītu 𓃟 𓏏 sod 𓁣 sog gilt
𐂋 ESAU der Eber 𓇋 𓊪 𓎛 𓃟 boar pig pork bull 𒋚 SHUBUR / ŠUBUR > εber

The dictionary gives very little to work with https://lineara.xyz/ but the entries on top are:

𐘻𐘯𐘃 MI-NU-TE minute ≈ manu 𐘻 established as hand 𐀗 moⁿ PIE √mon-u- manu-
𐘂𐘳𐘗 PA-TA-NE potane ⇔ 𐀡𐀴𐀛𐀊 πότνια potinia 'mistress'

Signs explained

𐙁 MA 𔓬 #MONS mountain ⇔ munus 𒊩 𐀴 𐘠 mon.ta feminine gender

𐘸 KI 𐀑 ki 𐘍·𐚠 ⇔ 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍 𐘹 TU

Speculation

𐘱𐘞 JA-SA Yasser Yasir 𐘇𐘞𐘞𐘴𐙱 A-SA-SA-RA Ashur 𓂀 Osiris 𓁹 𓊩 because of 𐘱 eye 'secret, bound'
